tweets.text:
It's Monday, must be time for another @EnvAgency failure.

"Farmers on average receive a pollution inspection from the Environment Agency every 263 years.

https://t.co/VMQ2CkIp4M

Our Flood Risk Manager, Stewart, talks you through the latest on the #Kendal Flood Scheme from our Flood Hub in the town. 

You can read more online 👉https://t.co/FUci329XTA

Make sure you're following @envagencynw & @TheFloodHub for regular updates on the #Kendal scheme. https://t.co/KiYa1Om7Je

This does not bode well. The @EnvAgency chief @JamesBevanEA says the agency "lacks the powers and resources" to tackle farm pollution. Might've been worth mentioning this a little sooner? 
https://t.co/ufu58O0RI0

This week is customer service week👍

In a recent survey 93% of our customers were satisfied and comments included “I was VERY impressed and grateful to both of your employees for their care and attention”  

#TeamEA  #NCSW20 https://t.co/ylWBzJP3Yj
Revealed: How often sewage is discharged into our rivers and the sea https://t.co/MEKQUSbH3j
@EnvAgency @britishhydrosoc @johncurtinEA Looking forward to the day EA start removing the floating wort on the River Mole. A flood waiting to happen! https://t.co/8wtizh4oMx

John Curtin, our executive director of flood and coastal risk management, has won the @britishhydrosoc President's Prize.

The award acknowledges the ground-breaking nature of the #FCERMSrategy and John's inspirational leadership.

Congrats @JohnCurtinEA! https://t.co/ho35E5zNww

tweets.text:
The proof: 1 year post-restoration a previously barren, silt-smothered and fish-impassable section of the River Test now produces buckets of juvenile wild trout!
#ChalkStream
#WildRiversForWildFish #WillTravelForGravel

A @WessexRivers @WildTroutTrust and @EnvAgencySE partnership https://t.co/fnvXXeIHu0

Just 6 months after admitting to 8,400 pollution incidents in court @SouthernWater still manage to top the 2019 polluter in chief scoreboard.

What's clear is the @EnvAgency has no control over this company and even clearer, it is now time for @Ofwat to revoke SW's licence. https://t.co/1KqXjd6XYE

@AvonFireRescue @darrenpjones Surely a huge claim from local residents as well as legal action from the @EnvAgency can be the only courses of action now?  I suspect that the insurers may be looking at that fire plan very closely... they are heavily exposed financially.  #EnoughIsEnough action needed

Form AqHerb01: Agreement to use herbicides in or near water? https://t.co/9NZVXCmMXN

@RachSalv @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA I’m a Riverfly Monitor. The Riverfly Monitoring Initiative is an EA funded project. I have reported two pollution incidents to their hotline. On both occasions the person on the other end of the line has not known what the Riverfly Monitoring Initiative is

tweets.text:
Join us online on Monday, 12 October to watch the webcast of the event, #Forest futures in the #Asia-Pacific region at World Forest Week! 

https://t.co/kCQAyqY9zB #COFO25 https://t.co/ibQHKuUEPS

@PHE_SouthWest Following this I would suggest have a detailed discussion with the company involved @BristolCouncil @EnvAgency on how you communicate a serious incident that affects health. You report at 16. 20. @BristolCouncil hasn’t tweeted directly with advice nor the @EnvAgency. Useless !
@EnvAgencySE @MariaHerlihyEA Lovely. If you go stand by the concrete curve on Romney Lock tail & look upstream, you'll see the view that Turner depicted in his Thames Lock nr Windsor painting.

More good news at #Avonmouth. Yet another fire at @SimsMM those of secret meeting with cllrs and no prosecutions for multiple breaches of the law. No warnings to local residents #CoverdUpAgain @MarvinJRees @EnvAgency https://t.co/cZ7mDhg3fp

As a little contrast everyday water companies leak 2,954,000,000 litres of water from their underinvested, under repaired, faulty, leaky pipes.

Yep that's 1,078,210,000,000 litres of water per year stolen from our rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/RkJP0KAsoX

Do you have experience in #NFM natural #flood management? If so, we need your help with a project that is looking at making the funding process easier. Tell us more about your experience with NFM funding in this quick survey: https://t.co/N8bYFaKQyn @slowtheflow_UK https://t.co/5ZUTW8Uf9G

Read about the #MytholmroydFAS #flood defences & the old Caldene Bridge in the latest issue of  @ValleyLifeMg e Magazine which is being delivered to homes & businesses in #Calderdale
https://t.co/acZHfaMlT2 https://t.co/ZlawffoTiE
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/bNAXQbWW1G

We’re working with @WTBBC and @BhamCityCouncil on improvements to R.Cole in #Birmingham. Just completed an area through #BordesleyGreen  creating a meander, marginal shelves & in-channel habitat in a straightened section of river. Volunteers to plant shelves with native species https://t.co/MCPO1nVy9O
England’s water companies receive worst pollution ratings for 8 years https://t.co/ypi1bEAM2H

Another day of helping coordinate #MultiAgency response to ongoing incident at @bristolport with @ASPolice @bristolportpol @AvonFireRescue @PHE_SouthWest @BristolCouncil @sgloscouncil @metoffice @EnvAgencySW . Utilising @jesip999 Principles & using @RD_Gov https://t.co/sOqBLZFfpC

tweets.text: @BalutHelen @java_jive @kittyloganmedia @Feargal_Sharkey @RachSalv @10DowningStreet @EnvAgency As a chalk stream, which is fed by ground water, there isn’t as much dilution particularly when water levels are low at the end of summer. The Chess turns from crystal clear to grey/brown and oxygen levels drop which is harmful to aquatic life.

Field teams are on the ground again today checking structures and clearing trash screens etc. We are also proactively managing flows on the Parrett by using Monksleaze Clyse and the Sowy system. @EnvAgencySW @GaryBCutts https://t.co/9wkmpRSEs2

tweets.text:
The risk from the fire at #avonmouth to children playing outside is low. 

However, those with pre existing health conditions should take care and stay indoors and ensure they have their medication available.

INCIDENT: Crews from Nailsea and our High Volume Pump (HVP) are in Avonmouth assisting with a fire involving 20,000 tons of scrap metal.

The incident is ongoing and with smoke spreading as far as Thornbury. Please close windows &doors in the area.
 
#AvonFire #HVP #firefighters https://t.co/UhSrtNNm9l

tweets.text:
Thousands of fish will be killed in the double-decker sized cooling tunnels at Hinkley Point C. @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO please make the right decision and make sure an Acoustic Fish Deterrent is installed, as the DCO states. #SaveSevernsFish 

https://t.co/XCDB3kT04r

@thameswater @EnvAgencySE TW - lots of phone calls about a leak from another property going under our house but constant denial from your teams. Drilled through the floor and there running water are you going to still deny there’s a problem? https://t.co/l6z3SZgTlY

We are still in attendance at a large fire in Avonmouth. The smoke from the incident is affecting a large area. Advice is to close all windows and doors and stay inside where possible. @PHE_uk @BristolCouncil @EnvAgencySW @bristolportpol @ASPolice #teamwork
@CatlingJulia @thameswater @EnvAgency @gregsmith_uk @BBCWatchdog Hi Julia, I’m really sorry to hear about this. Can you send us a DM with some further details, please? Thanks, Hannah
@river_usk You would expect @EnvAgency to step in and make sure fish are properly protected
@EnvAgencySE @LondonFire please can you help residents in Longford Village and Parts of Colnbrook are under water they need Sandbags ASAP 🙏🏽

tweets.text: @WorcsTravel @worcscc @Wychavon @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgencyMids @CllrAHardman @HWFireControl People generally think the signs are clear as are the barriers. I always remind people that if they move them, and drive through floodwater it will invalidate their insurance if they get stuck (as ppl often do by Eck Bridge!) or have issues afterwards with their vehicle. 🤦🏼‍♀️

Sadly after a wet weekend more rain overnight & tomorrow. Not expecting significant problems but do pls keep using https://t.co/vKsRlvVySm for most update info on @EnvAgencyNW #flood warnings / alerts; river levels. #floodaware https://t.co/ifdKTdXYcg
@CertusCC @EnvAgency Well from my immediate families perspective @NatResWales should be in there making a stink. My visitors don't understand human political boundries
@The26thchoice1 @worcscc @Wychavon @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgencyMids @CllrAHardman @HWFireControl Thanks for letting us know, we'll get it checked again
And we wonder why my visitors go missing. https://t.co/yzgSnyvMLj
